item.title: github: Copilot usage metrics now includes enterprise-level GitHub Copilot CLI activity
item.description:
GitHub Copilot enterprise usage metrics now include GitHub Copilot CLI telemetry, expanding what’s counted in enterprise-level reporting.

  • Source: GitHub

item.description:
GitHub Copilot usage metrics are now generally available, providing a centralized view of team adoption and usage.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Actions now supports uploading and downloading non-zipped artifacts
item.description:
GitHub Actions artifacts can now be uploaded and downloaded without automatic ZIP compression in workflows.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot metrics report URLs update
item.description:
GitHub Copilot usage metrics API download URLs are now served from a new endpoint; report data, API contract, and response schema are unchanged.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Enterprise AI Controls & agent control plane now generally available
item.description:
GitHub announced general availability of Enterprise AI Controls and the agent control plane for GitHub Enterprise administrators.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Claude and Codex now available for Copilot Business & Pro users
item.description:
GitHub Copilot Business and Copilot Pro customers can now use Anthropic Claude and OpenAI Codex as coding agents. Copilot Enterprise and Pro+ customers got access earlier in February 2026.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: macos-26 is now generally available for GitHub-hosted runners
item.description:
GitHub Actions’ macOS 26 runner image is now generally available for GitHub-hosted runners, moving out of public preview.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot Content Exclusion REST API in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot adds a new Content Exclusion REST API (JSON) in public preview for organization and enterprise admins to manage Copilot content exclusion rules programmatically.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Mobile: Track coding agent progress in real time with Live Notifications
item.description:
GitHub Mobile now supports Live Coding Agent Notifications to monitor Copilot coding agent activity and supported third-party agent sessions in real time from the mobile app.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Improved search on the issues dashboard
item.description:
GitHub is rolling out semantic (natural-language) search in public preview on the Issues dashboard over the coming week.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Org-level metrics API now includes pull request throughput metric parity
item.description:
GitHub expanded the organization-level Copilot Usage Metrics API to add pull request activity metrics, bringing the org-level endpoints closer to other metrics parity.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Generate pull request titles with Copilot on the web
item.description:
GitHub Copilot can now generate pull request titles directly on github.com when creating or editing a PR.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GPT-5.3-Codex is now available in github.com, GitHub Mobile, and Visual Studio
item.description:
GPT-5.3-Codex is generally available for GitHub Copilot paid tiers and can be used via Copilot Chat across github.com, GitHub Mobile, and Visual Studio.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Improved web search in Copilot on github.com
item.description:
Copilot Chat on github.com now supports model-native web search for certain models, allowing those models to use their built-in web browsing capability during chats.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot CLI is now generally available
item.description:
GitHub Copilot CLI is now generally available for all paid GitHub Copilot subscribers.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Enterprise Server 3.20 release candidate is available
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise Server 3.20 release candidate is available. The changelog post indicates improvements in deployment efficiency, monitoring, code security, and policy management, but provides no concrete details in the provided excerpt.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: CodeQL adds Go 1.26 and Kotlin 2.3.10 support and improves query accuracy
item.description:
CodeQL 2.24.2 adds support for Go 1.26 and Kotlin 2.3.10, and includes query accuracy improvements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Dependabot can group updates by dependency name across multiple directories
item.description:
Dependabot can now group update PRs by dependency name across multiple directories in a repository.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Code Quality: Organization-level dashboard in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Code Quality added an organization-level dashboard in public preview to view code health across repositories with Code Quality enabled.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Repository dashboard is now generally available
item.description:
GitHub’s repository dashboard has moved from public preview to general availability. It lets users find, filter, and save custom views of repositories they can access.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Enterprise-defined custom organization roles are generally available
item.description:
GitHub now generally makes available enterprise-defined custom organization roles to help enterprises standardize role-based access across multiple organizations.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: IP allow list coverage extended to EMU namespaces in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise Cloud now supports extending GitHub’s native IP allow list to user namespaces for Enterprise Managed Users (EMUs), available in public preview.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Enterprise team support in organization APIs
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise organization owners can now discover and manage both enterprise teams and organization teams via existing organization team API endpoints.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Organization-level Copilot usage metrics dashboard available in public preview
item.description:
GitHub has added an organization-level GitHub Copilot usage metrics dashboard in public preview, expanding access beyond enterprise-only dashboards.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Workflow dispatch API now returns run IDs
item.description:
GitHub’s Actions workflow dispatch API can now optionally return response metadata, including workflow run IDs, to help correlate a dispatch request with the resulting run.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot support in Zed generally available
item.description:
GitHub Copilot support in the Zed editor is now generally available via an official partnership. Copilot subscriptions (Pro, Pro+, Business, Enterprise) can authenticate and be used directly in Zed.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Changes to test merge commit generation for pull requests
item.description:
GitHub changed how often it generates test merge commits for open pull requests to reduce mergeability-check delays and improve reliability.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot coding agent model picker for Copilot Business and Enterprise
item.description:
GitHub announced a model picker for Copilot coding agent for Copilot Business and Enterprise users.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Selected Anthropic and OpenAI models are now deprecated
item.description:
GitHub deprecated a set of Anthropic and OpenAI models across all GitHub Copilot experiences effective February 17, 2026.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Projects: Import items based on a query and hierarchy view improvements
item.description:
GitHub Projects now lets you populate a new project by importing items returned from a search query, not only by importing from a repository. The hierarchy view also received usability improvements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Access all pull request comments without leaving the new Files changed page
item.description:
GitHub’s new pull request “Files changed” page now lets reviewers access all pull request comments without switching to the “Conversation” tab.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Gemini 3.1 Pro is now in public preview in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub Copilot is rolling out public preview access to Google’s Gemini 3.1 Pro model.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Pull request throughput and time to merge available in Copilot usage metrics API
item.description:
GitHub Copilot usage metrics APIs now include pull request outcomes metrics, enabling org-level reporting on PR throughput and time to merge.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Use Copilot coding agent with Windows projects
item.description:
Copilot coding agent can now be used with Windows projects, running tasks asynchronously in a GitHub Actions-powered development environment.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot coding agent supports code referencing
item.description:
Copilot coding agent now supports Copilot code referencing for generated code that matches code in public GitHub repositories.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Secret scanning improvements to extended metadata checks
item.description:
GitHub Secret Scanning now supports configuring extended metadata checks via security configurations, making it easier to enable these checks across many repositories.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Claude Opus 4.6 is now available in Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse
item.description:
Claude Opus 4.6 is now generally available in GitHub Copilot for Enterprise, Business, Pro, and Pro+ plans. It can be used in Copilot Chat on github.com and in supported IDEs.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Desktop 3.5.5 adds Git hooks support
item.description:
GitHub Desktop 3.5.5 adds support for Git hooks to address prior compatibility issues, especially with version managers and environment-dependent scripts.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: npm bulk trusted publishing config and script security now generally available
item.description:
npm CLI v11.10.0+ adds bulk management for OIDC trusted publishing configurations and makes a script security feature generally available.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: API access to billing usage reports in public preview
item.description:
GitHub is introducing a new REST API (public preview) that lets enterprise administrators request and download billing usage reports as CSV files.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Enterprise-wide credential management tools for incident response
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise Cloud adds enterprise-wide credential management actions for enterprise owners to use during high-impact security incident response.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Claude Sonnet 4.6 is now generally available in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub Copilot is rolling out support for Anthropic Claude Sonnet 4.6, now generally available. GitHub notes early testing shows strong performance on agentic coding, especially search.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: MCP Registry and more improvements in Copilot in Eclipse
item.description:
GitHub shipped updates to Copilot in Eclipse aimed at improving context handling, workflow smoothness, and customization.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Delegate tasks to Copilot coding agent from Visual Studio
item.description:
Visual Studio can now delegate coding tasks to GitHub Copilot coding agent, which runs asynchronously in the cloud and produces a draft pull request.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Assign issues to Copilot coding agent from Raycast
item.description:
GitHub Copilot coding agent can now be assigned issues directly from Raycast, enabling you to delegate tasks to the agent and later review its work.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Required reviewer rule is now generally available
item.description:
GitHub’s “required reviewer” rule for repository rulesets is now generally available. It lets admins require approvals from specific reviewers for changes targeting defined branches and paths across an org/enterprise.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Custom properties and rule insights improvements
item.description:
GitHub shipped updates to organization/enterprise policy controls: custom properties now allow requiring an explicit value, and rule insights provide improved visibility into rule activity.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: New features and improvements in GitHub Copilot in JetBrains IDEs
item.description:
GitHub Copilot for JetBrains IDEs received an update adding preview support for Agent Skills plus UX improvements in inline chat and settings.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Updated GitHub status page experience
item.description:
GitHub updated its status page to make incident details easier to find and more useful during active incidents. The status site now includes a 90-day historical view of availability.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Show profile names (first and last name) alongside user handles
item.description:
GitHub now lets enterprise and organization admins choose whether to display users’ profile names (first and last) alongside their handles across the enterprise UI.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: New repository settings for configuring pull request access
item.description:
GitHub added two new repository settings to control how a repo accepts contributions via pull requests, including an option to disable pull requests entirely.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Network configuration changes for Copilot coding agent
item.description:
GitHub announced upcoming network configuration changes for Copilot coding agent, which runs background tasks in its own GitHub Actions-powered environment.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Agentic Workflows are now in technical preview
item.description:
GitHub introduced Agentic Workflows in technical preview, enabling AI agents to run repository automation tasks inside GitHub Actions. Workflows can be authored in Markdown rather than YAML, delegating task planning/execution to the agent.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Mobile: Model picker for Copilot coding agent
item.description:
GitHub Mobile now lets Copilot Pro and Pro+ subscribers select an AI model when starting a Copilot coding agent session.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Track additional Dependabot configuration changes in audit logs
item.description:
GitHub added two new audit log event types to track additional Dependabot settings changes at the organization and enterprise levels.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GPT-5.3-Codex is now generally available for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub Copilot is rolling out general availability of OpenAI’s GPT-5.3-Codex model.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Apps can now utilize public preview Enterprise Teams APIs via fine-grained permissions
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise admins can now authorize GitHub Apps (using fine-grained enterprise teams permissions) to access Enterprise Teams API endpoints in public preview. Previously, these endpoints required a classic personal access token.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Fast mode for Claude Opus 4.6 is now in preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub Copilot is rolling out a research/public preview of Claude Opus 4.6 “Fast mode.” The mode increases output token generation speed by up to 2.5×.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: CodeQL 2.24.1 improves Maven private registry support and improves query accuracy
item.description:
CodeQL 2.24.1 was released with improved support for Maven private registries and enhancements to query accuracy.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Improved pull request Files changed – February 5 updates
item.description:
GitHub updated the new pull request “Files changed” experience with CODEOWNERS validation and performance improvements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Pinned comments on GitHub Issues
item.description:
GitHub Issues now supports pinning a comment on an issue to keep key information visible and reduce noise while scanning discussions.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Claude Opus 4.6 is now generally available for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub Copilot is rolling out support for Anthropic’s Claude Opus 4.6 model and marking it as generally available.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Actions: Self-hosted runner minimum version enforcement extended
item.description:
GitHub extended the deadline for configuration-time minimum version enforcement for self-hosted Actions runners by one week.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Actions: Early February 2026 updates
item.description:
GitHub Actions’ early February 2026 update adds custom runner autoscaling, broadens security controls to all users, and provides early access to new Windows and macOS runner images.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Showing tool calls and other improvements to Copilot chat on the web
item.description:
GitHub Copilot Chat on github.com now shows tool call details in chat responses and includes additional performance and UX improvements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio Code v1.109 – January Release
item.description:
GitHub Copilot for VS Code v1.109 (January 2026) adds agent-driven workflows, improves agent session management, and introduces agent support for Anthropic Claude models.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio — January update
item.description:
January 2026 updates to GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio add colorized code completions, the ability to partially accept a completion, and general productivity improvements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Dependabot now supports OIDC authentication
item.description:
GitHub Dependabot can now authenticate to private registries using OpenID Connect (OIDC), removing the need to store long-lived registry credentials as repository secrets for Dependabot update jobs.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: The Dependabot Proxy is now open source with an MIT license
item.description:
GitHub has open-sourced the Dependabot Proxy and released it under the permissive MIT license, allowing developers to review the implementation (including how authentication is handled for different package ecosystems), reuse it, and contribute.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Docker and Docker Compose version upgrades on hosted runners
item.description:
On February 9, 2026, GitHub will upgrade Docker and Docker Compose on all Windows and Ubuntu hosted runner images except ubuntu-slim, allowing workflows to use the latest Docker releases. Users should test workflows and pin or adjust tooling if they depend on previous Docker behavior.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Codespaces is now in public preview for GitHub Enterprise with data residency
item.description:
GitHub Codespaces is now in public preview for GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency, enabling secure, configurable, instantly available cloud development environments while helping organizations meet strict compliance requirements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: CodeQL 2.24.0 adds Swift 6.2 and .NET 10 support, and improves file handling for minified JavaScript
item.description:
CodeQL 2.24.0 is a new release of the static analysis engine used by GitHub code scanning. This update adds support for Swift 6.2, compatibility with .NET 10, and improves file handling for minified JavaScript to help detection and analysis of issues in those languages.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot metrics in GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced that Copilot metrics — including usage data, code generation dashboards, and a metrics API — are available in public preview for GitHub Enterprise Cloud customers with data residency, enabling organizations to store and query Copilot metrics according to regional compliance requirements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Actions: Smarter editing, clearer debugging, and a new case function
item.description:
GitHub released several updates to GitHub Actions that make it easier to write, validate, and troubleshoot workflow logic — especially workflows that use if: conditionals — by offering smarter editing, clearer debugging, and a new case function.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: arm64 standard runners are now available in private repositories
item.description:
GitHub now offers Linux and Windows arm64 standard GitHub-hosted runners for private repositories, available on the free tier so you can run arm64 CI workflows across all repositories.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Closing down notice of legacy Copilot metrics APIs
item.description:
GitHub is closing down three legacy Copilot metrics APIs as it transitions to newer, more comprehensive usage metrics endpoints. Support for the legacy APIs will be limited, and users should plan to migrate to the updated endpoints.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Improved search for GitHub Issues in public preview
item.description:
GitHub has launched an improved search for GitHub Issues, now in public preview. The new search leverages a semantic index to help you find the exact issue you’re looking for more easily.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: ACP support in Copilot CLI is now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot CLI now supports the Agent Client Protocol (ACP), an industry-standard protocol that allows AI agents and clients to communicate, and this feature is available in public preview to enable easier integration with third-party tools, IDEs, and automation systems.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub MCP Server: New Projects tools, OAuth scope filtering, and new features
item.description:
GitHub released the MCP Server, adding improved management for GitHub Projects with more efficient use of the context window, automatic filtering of tools based on a token’s OAuth scopes/permissions, and additional new features and Projects-focused tools.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Changes to GitHub Dependabot pull request comment commands
item.description:
GitHub deprecated and removed several Dependabot-specific pull request comment commands (announced Oct 2025) and replaced them with GitHub’s native pull request features; users should migrate any automation or scripts that relied on those commands.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Introducing the Agents tab in your repository
item.description:
GitHub added a new Agents tab inside repositories to manage Copilot coding agent tasks. The update brings a mission-control style interface and refreshed look and feel so you can run and oversee agents directly from the repository.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GPT-5.2-Codex is now available in Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse
item.description:
GitHub announced that GPT-5.2-Codex is generally available for Copilot Enterprise, Copilot Business, Copilot Pro, and Copilot Pro+, and is now accessible in GitHub Copilot Chat on the web and mobile as well as integrated into Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Improved pull request “Files changed” page on by default
item.description:
GitHub has made the improved pull request “Files changed” experience the default for all users. The experience, previously available in public preview, is intended to be familiar while enhancing how files are viewed and reviewed in pull requests.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Faster loading for GitHub Issues
item.description:
GitHub reports a significant performance improvement for GitHub Issues: 35% of issue views now load in under 200ms, up from 2% at the start of the year. The change is announced on the GitHub Blog as the first in a series of improvements to issue loading performance.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: 1 vCPU Linux runner now generally available in GitHub Actions
item.description:
GitHub Actions now offers 1 vCPU Linux runners as generally available (GA). These lower-cost runners are optimized for automation tasks and issue operations and are available to all customers.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot CLI: Plan before you build, steer as you go
item.description:
GitHub announced updates to Copilot CLI that introduce more powerful reasoning models and intelligent workflow features, enabling developers to plan work before generating code and to steer interactive terminal conversations as they go.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Install and Use GitHub Copilot CLI directly from the GitHub CLI
item.description:
GitHub CLI now provides a built-in gh copilot command that lets users install and run the GitHub Copilot CLI directly from the GitHub CLI. The previous GitHub Copilot extension for gh has been deprecated in favor of this integrated approach.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: CodeQL 2.23.9 has been released
item.description:
GitHub announced the release of CodeQL 2.23.9, an update to the static analysis engine used by GitHub code scanning. The release notes indicate there are no user-facing changes; the announcement appeared on the GitHub Blog (2026-01-20).

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Strengthen your supply chain with code-to-cloud traceability and SLSA Build Level 3 security
item.description:
GitHub now lets you link build artifacts—such as containers and binaries—to GitHub and attach storage and deployment context even when those artifacts live outside GitHub. This capability provides code-to-cloud traceability and supports meeting SLSA Build Level 3 security requirements by capturing provenance and deployment context for external artifacts.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Enterprise-scoped budgets that exclude cost center usage in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced a public preview that lets Enterprise customers create enterprise-scoped budgets which exclude cost-center usage so parts of an enterprise can be allowed additional usage while other parts remain limited.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot now supports OpenCode
item.description:
GitHub announced a formal partnership with OpenCode that enables authentication of GitHub Copilot subscriptions (Pro, Pro+, Business, Enterprise) on the OpenCode platform, allowing subscribers to use Copilot with OpenCode.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Rate limiting for actions cache entries
item.description:
GitHub announced a new rate limit for Actions cache uploads: repositories are limited to 200 new cache entry uploads per minute. Downloads of cache entries are not affected.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Secret scanning extended metadata to be automatically enabled for certain repositories
item.description:
GitHub secret scanning will add support for extended metadata checks in repository security configurations, with the change taking effect on February 18, 2026. Extended metadata is implemented as a nested feature under existing validity checks and will be automatically enabled for certain repositories.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Agentic memory for GitHub Copilot is in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced that Agentic Copilot memory is in public preview for all paid GitHub Copilot plans. The feature lets Copilot learn and retain useful details about your repositories to provide more context-aware assistance as you work.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Hierarchy view now available in GitHub Projects
item.description:
GitHub Projects has introduced a Hierarchy view in public preview, allowing users to see full issue hierarchies directly inside project table views to improve visibility into complex issue relationships.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot bring your own key (BYOK) enhancements
item.description:
GitHub announced enhancements to Copilot’s Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) capability: it now supports additional APIs, includes new configuration options, and adds more provider integrations so enterprises can connect models (including those that use the Responses API).

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot SDK in technical preview
item.description:
GitHub released the Copilot SDK in technical preview, offering language-specific SDKs that let developers programmatically access the GitHub Copilot CLI.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot CLI: Enhanced agents, context management, and new ways to install
item.description:
GitHub announced updates to Copilot CLI that deliver enhanced agent capabilities, improved context management for terminal workflows, and additional installation options to make the tool easier to adopt and more native to developer terminals.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GPT-5.2-Codex is now generally available in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub announced that GPT-5.2-Codex is now generally available in GitHub Copilot and can be selected from the Copilot model picker for eligible plans.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Organization custom properties now generally available
item.description:
GitHub has made organization custom properties generally available, enabling enterprise administrators to attach metadata to organizations and use those properties to automatically target enterprise rulesets for governance and automation.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Upcoming deprecation of select GitHub Copilot models from Claude, Google, and OpenAI
item.description:
GitHub announced on Jan 13, 2026 that it will deprecate select GitHub Copilot models from Claude, Google, and OpenAI as part of routine retirements to prioritize newer, more capable models and maintain a fast, high‑quality Copilot experience.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: New fine-grained permission for artifact metadata is now generally available
item.description:
GitHub released a new artifact_metadata permission (now generally available) to provide finer-grained API control over artifact-related metadata, replacing the broader contents:read and contents:write permissions for that metadata.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Selectively showing "act on your behalf" warning for GitHub Apps is in public preview
item.description:
GitHub updated the consent page to selectively show the “act on your behalf” warning for GitHub Apps. When an app is used only as a sign-in method, the warning is reduced or omitted; the change is available in public preview.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Controlling who can request apps for your organization is now generally available
item.description:
GitHub announced general availability of a feature that gives organizations more granular control over who can request GitHub Apps and OAuth apps, enabling stricter governance while preserving flexibility in security posture.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Deprecation of user to organization account transformation
item.description:
On January 12, 2026 GitHub deprecated the ability to convert a personal user account directly into an organization. Users should use the Move workflow to selectively migrate content instead. The change was announced on the GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Gemini 3 Flash is now available in Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse
item.description:
GitHub released Gemini 3 Flash in public preview for GitHub Copilot Chat inside Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse, available to Copilot Enterprise, Copilot Business, Copilot Pro, and Copilot Pro+ users.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Reduced pricing for GitHub-hosted runners usage
item.description:
GitHub has reduced pricing for GitHub-hosted runners — price cuts of up to 39% are now in effect; the change was announced on December 16, 2025.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Improved performance for GitHub Actions workflows page
item.description:
The GitHub Actions workflows page now handles very large workflows (more than 300 jobs) by using lazy loading for smoother performance, and it also adds the ability to filter jobs to help navigate large workflows.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Control who can request apps for your organization now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub has launched a public preview that gives organizations more granular control over who can request GitHub Apps and OAuth apps, enabling stricter governance while preserving flexibility in security posture.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: You can now require reviews before closing Dependabot alerts with delegated alert dismissal
item.description:
GitHub announced Delegated alert dismissal, a feature that requires a review process before Dependabot alerts can be closed. It is available to GitHub Code Security customers and was reported on the GitHub Blog (changelog entry dated 2025-12-19).

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot Memory early access for Pro and Pro+
item.description:
GitHub announced that Copilot Memory is now available in early access for Copilot Pro and Pro+ users. The feature is supported in the Copilot Coding Agent and Copilot Code Review. The provided article text is truncated; full details are on the GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: CodeQL 2.23.7 and 2.23.8 add security queries for Go and Rust
item.description:
GitHub released CodeQL versions 2.23.7 and 2.23.8, adding new security queries for Go and Rust. CodeQL is the static analysis engine used by GitHub Code Scanning and Code Quality to detect and help remediate code-quality and security issues.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Assigning GitHub Copilot to an issue now adds you as an assignee
item.description:
When you assign an issue to GitHub Copilot, you are now automatically added as an assignee so you can track that work more easily with assignee filters.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Advanced Security trials now available for more GitHub Enterprise customers
item.description:
GitHub is offering more GitHub Enterprise customers a self-serve trial of GitHub Advanced Security so they can evaluate GitHub Code Security and GitHub Secret Protection.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot now supports Agent Skills
item.description:
GitHub Copilot now supports Agent Skills — self-contained folders of instructions, scripts, and resources that teach Copilot to perform specialized, repeatable tasks and workflows.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Claude Opus 4.5 is now generally available in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
Claude Opus 4.5 is now generally available in GitHub Copilot and can be accessed in GitHub Copilot Chat on github.com for Copilot Enterprise, Copilot Business, Copilot Pro, and Copilot Pro+ customers. The announcement was published on The GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Enterprise Cloud data residency in Japan is generally available
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise Cloud data residency in Japan is now generally available, letting Enterprise Cloud customers choose to store their code and repository data in Japan to support compliance, privacy, and performance needs.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Teams management now moved to Settings
item.description:
GitHub moved Teams management out of the left-hand navigation into a dedicated page under Settings to simplify navigation and surface other important features more easily.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot code review preview features now supported in GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency now supports Copilot code review preview features, enabling organizations to try agentic code review capabilities directly in pull requests while keeping data within their residency region.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Enterprise-level pull request activity now included in Copilot Usage Metrics in public preview
item.description:
GitHub has added enterprise-level pull request activity metrics to Copilot Usage Metrics (now in public preview), letting organizations see PR creation and review activity across the enterprise and how GitHub Copilot participates in that workflow.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GPT-5.2 is now generally available in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub announced that GPT-5.2 is now generally available in GitHub Copilot (Dec 17, 2025). The model is available to Copilot Enterprise, Copilot Business, Copilot Pro, and Copilot Pro+ customers and can be used in GitHub Copilot Chat on github.com and GitHub Mobile.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GPT-5.1-Codex-Max is now generally available in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub has made the GPT-5.1-Codex-Max model generally available in GitHub Copilot for Copilot Enterprise, Copilot Business, Copilot Pro, and Copilot Pro+. The model can be used in GitHub Copilot Chat on github.com and GitHub Mobile.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GPT-5.1 and GPT-5.1-Codex are now generally available in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub announced that GPT-5.1 and GPT-5.1-Codex are now generally available for Copilot Enterprise, Copilot Business, Copilot Pro, and Copilot Pro+, and can be accessed in GitHub Copilot Chat on github.com.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Dynamic Copilot prompts on GitHub Docs
item.description:
GitHub announced dynamic Copilot prompts on GitHub Docs, allowing users to launch GitHub Copilot prompts directly from select documentation pages to move seamlessly from reading docs to using Copilot.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Gemini 3 Flash is now in public preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub announced that Gemini 3 Flash, a speed-focused variant of Gemini 3 suited for tasks where low latency matters, is rolling out in public preview for GitHub Copilot.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot code review now available for organization members without a license
item.description:
GitHub announced that organizations on Copilot Enterprise or Copilot Business can run Copilot code review on all pull requests, including those authored by members who do not have an individual Copilot license; usage is billed seamlessly to the organization.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Enterprise governance and policy improvements for secret scanning
item.description:
GitHub announced the general availability of enterprise governance and policy improvements for secret scanning, including enterprise-level delegated bypass controls for push protection and support for the new Enterprise Security Manager to provide stronger, more centralized controls and delegation for secret scanning across enterprises.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: C++ code editing tools for GitHub Copilot in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced that C++ code editing tools for GitHub Copilot are now in public preview, delivered with the latest Visual Studio 2026 Insiders release. The tools extend Copilot’s ability to understand and modify C++ code inside the IDE.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Dependabot version updates now support Julia
item.description:
GitHub Dependabot’s version updates now support Julia projects, allowing automatic updates of Julia dependencies.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Dependabot version updates now support Bazel
item.description:
GitHub announced that Dependabot version updates now support Bazel projects, allowing automatic version updates for dependencies declared with Bzlmod or in WORKSPACE files.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Dependabot version updates now support OpenTofu
item.description:
GitHub announced that Dependabot version updates now support OpenTofu, allowing projects that use OpenTofu to receive automated dependency updates to keep their infrastructure code current.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Dependabot security updates now support uv
item.description:
Dependabot now supports security alerts and automatic dependency updates for the uv ecosystem. When vulnerabilities are found in uv dependencies, Dependabot can open security alerts and create pull requests to update to secure versions.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Coming soon: Simpler pricing and a better experience for GitHub Actions
item.description:
Starting January 1, 2026, GitHub will lower prices for GitHub-hosted runners by up to 39% (varying by machine type) to deliver simpler pricing and a better GitHub Actions experience; free usage minute quotas will remain unchanged.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Track organization Copilot usage
item.description:
GitHub announced Copilot usage APIs that let organizations retrieve aggregated and user-specific usage metrics, including statistics for different Copilot features, to monitor adoption and consumption.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: More accurate Copilot Autofix usage metrics on security overview
item.description:
GitHub updated the security overview dashboard to provide more accurate metrics for CodeQL alerts fixed using Copilot autofixes by refining how autofix usage is calculated, improving visibility into adoption and effectiveness without changing the fixes themselves.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Code scanning alert assignees are now generally available
item.description:
GitHub has made code scanning alert assignees generally available. Teams can now assign individual code scanning alerts to specific people to create clear ownership and improve tracking and remediation of security vulnerabilities.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Gemini 3 Pro is now available in Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse
item.description:
Gemini 3 Pro is available in public preview for Copilot Enterprise, Copilot Business, Copilot Pro, and Copilot Pro+ users and can be accessed via GitHub Copilot Chat and directly in Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Better diagnostics for VNET injected runners and required self-hosted runner upgrades
item.description:
GitHub announced that GitHub-hosted larger runners using Azure VNET-injection now provide detailed network diagnostics when connectivity problems occur, replacing generic pool errors with per-endpoint visibility and drill-down information. The changelog also calls attention to required upgrades for self-hosted runners.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Review commit-by-commit, improved filtering, and more in the pull request “Files changed” public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced a public preview update to the pull request “Files changed” view that closes a major gap by adding review commit-by-commit, improves commit filtering, and includes other enhancements to make reviewing changes in PRs easier.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Post as Admin now available in GitHub Discussions
item.description:
Repository administrators can now post and comment in GitHub Discussions using an “Admin” badge to mark official responses. The option to post as Admin appears in the discussion compose UI so admins can distinguish official repository replies from their personal contributions.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Repository dashboard: Find, search, and save queries in preview
item.description:
GitHub announced a preview of a new Repository dashboard that helps users find repositories more easily by letting them search and save queries. The dashboard is intended to simplify navigating many projects and cross-team collaboration. (See: https://github.blog/changelog/2025-12-11-repository-dashboard-find-search-and-save-queries-in-preview)

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: OpenAI’s GPT-5.2 is now in public preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
OpenAI’s GPT-5.2 is now in public preview for GitHub Copilot, a model optimized for long context handling and front-end UI generation, and is available to Copilot Pro, Pro+, Business, and Enterprise users (announced on the GitHub Blog, 2025-12-11).

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Auto model selection is generally available in GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio Code
item.description:
GitHub Copilot’s auto model selection is now generally available in Visual Studio Code for all Copilot plans. The ‘auto’ setting lets Copilot automatically pick the most appropriate model for you based on current model and context.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Spark: Improvements, DPA coverage, & dedicated SKU
item.description:
GitHub announced a set of improvements for Spark, introduced a dedicated Spark SKU, and confirmed that Spark is covered by the GitHub Data Processing Agreement (DPA).

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Enterprise Server 3.19 is now generally available
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise Server (GHES) 3.19 is now generally available. The release focuses on improving deployment efficiency, expanding monitoring capabilities, strengthening code security, and refining policy management with a more intuitive flow.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: The GitHub MCP Server adds support for tool-specific configuration, and more
item.description:
GitHub announced that the MCP Server now supports tool-specific configuration so you can customize behavior per tool and reduce context window usage. The feature is exposed via a new X-MCP-Tools header and was listed on the GitHub Blog changelog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: npm classic tokens revoked, session-based auth and CLI token management now available
item.description:
On 2025-12-09 GitHub completed the deprecation of npm classic tokens by revoking them and moving to session-based authentication. At the same time GitHub released CLI token management features so developers can manage authentication tokens from the command line. This change is part of a security hardening effort and requires affected users and automation to re-authenticate and adopt the new session-based flows or updated tokens.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Dependabot-based dependency graphs for Go
item.description:
GitHub announced Dependabot-based dependency graphs for Go projects to provide more complete and accurate transitive dependency trees, as part of continued supply chain security improvements for package ecosystem support.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Enterprise teams product limits increased by over 10x
item.description:
GitHub announced that the Enterprise Teams public preview now supports creating and managing up to 2,500 enterprise teams per enterprise, a more than 10× increase in product limits.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Model picker for Copilot coding agent for Copilot Pro and Pro+ subscribers
item.description:
GitHub added a model picker to the Copilot coding agent so Copilot Pro and Pro+ subscribers can choose which model the asynchronous background agent uses when starting tasks from the agents UI.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Repository custom properties: GraphQL API and URL type
item.description:
GitHub added two enhancements to repository custom properties: a GraphQL API for managing them and a new URL property type, to help organize and manage repositories at scale.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Track Copilot code generation metrics in a dashboard
item.description:
GitHub added Copilot lines-of-code (LoC) metrics to the code generation insights dashboard. Administrators can view these metrics for their enterprise via the Enterprises page.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Actions workflow dispatch workflows now support 25 inputs
item.description:
GitHub Actions workflow_dispatch triggers now accept up to 25 inputs (previously 10), making manually triggered workflows easier to parameterize for more complex scenarios.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Notifications triggered by spam accounts are now correctly hidden
item.description:
GitHub improved handling of notifications from spammy repositories and users so that notifications triggered by known spam accounts are now correctly hidden, producing clearer and more accurate notification counts.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: OpenAI’s GPT-5.1-Codex-Max is now in public preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub announced that OpenAI’s GPT-5.1-Codex-Max is rolling out in public preview for GitHub Copilot and will be available to Copilot Pro, Pro+, Business, and Enterprise customers.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: CodeQL 2.23.6 adds Swift 6.2.1 and new C# security queries
item.description:
CodeQL 2.23.6 has been released, adding support for Swift 6.2.1 and introducing new C# security queries. CodeQL is the static analysis engine behind GitHub code scanning, used to find and remediate security issues. The announcement appeared on The GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio — November update
item.description:
The November 2025 update for GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio announced the general availability of Visual Studio 2026, added new Copilot actions integrated into the IDE, and rolled out additional improvements; full details are in the GitHub Blog changelog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Claude Opus 4.5 is now available in Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse
item.description:
GitHub announced that Claude Opus 4.5 is available in public preview for Copilot Enterprise, Copilot Business, Copilot Pro, and Copilot Pro+. The model can be accessed via GitHub Copilot Chat and is integrated into major IDEs including Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Assign issues to Copilot using the API
item.description:
GitHub added the ability to assign issues to Copilot via both the GraphQL and REST APIs, with options to set the target repository and base branch and to provide custom instructions and custom agents for how Copilot should handle the issue.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Enterprise Server 3.19 release candidate is now available
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise Server (GHES) 3.19 release candidate is now available, focusing on improved deployment efficiency, enhanced monitoring, stronger code security, and better policy management with a more intuitive flow.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Secret scanning updates — November 2025
item.description:
GitHub Secret Scanning received updates in November 2025 that added support for 24 new secret types via new provider patterns; details were published in the GitHub Blog changelog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot Spaces: Public spaces and code view support
item.description:
GitHub announced three major updates to Copilot Spaces: support for public spaces, individual sharing controls, and the ability to add files to a space directly from the github.com code viewer.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Block repository administrators from installing GitHub Apps on their own now generally available
item.description:
GitHub rolled out a new organization-level setting (now generally available) that lets organization owners prevent repository administrators from installing GitHub Apps on repositories, giving owners tighter control over app installation and repository surface area.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot agent sessions from external apps are now available on GitHub Mobile for Android
item.description:
GitHub Mobile for Android adds a new Android sharesheet custom action that lets you share content from other apps to start Copilot agent sessions directly in the mobile app.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Secret scanning alert assignees, security campaigns are generally available
item.description:
GitHub announced that secret scanning alert assignees and security campaigns are now generally available. Alert assignees will receive email notifications to help teams track and remediate secret scanning alerts more effectively.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Secrets in unlisted GitHub gists are reported to secret scanning partners
item.description:
As of 2025-11-25, GitHub will report publicly leaked secrets found in unlisted gists to the appropriate secret scanning partners, extending secret-scanning reporting beyond only listed/public gists.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Code scanning default setup bypasses GitHub Actions policy blocks
item.description:
GitHub changed code scanning’s default setup so it will run even when an organization enforces restrictive GitHub Actions policies that normally prevent certain workflows from running. Previously those policies could block the code scanning default setup.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Custom labels configuration option for Dependabot self-hosted and larger GitHub-hosted Actions runners now generally available at the organization level
item.description:
Dependabot update jobs can now target specific self-hosted and larger GitHub-hosted Actions runners by using custom labels. The feature, previously limited to a single dependabot label, is now generally available at the organization level and provides finer control over where Dependabot runs.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Custom labels configuration option for Dependabot self-hosted and larger GitHub-hosted Actions runners now generally available at the organization level
item.description:
Dependabot update jobs can now target specific self-hosted and larger GitHub-hosted Actions runners by using custom labels. The feature, previously limited to a single dependabot label, is now generally available at the organization level and provides finer control over where Dependabot runs.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Claude Opus 4.5 is in public preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
Anthropic’s Claude Opus 4.5 is now rolling out in public preview for GitHub Copilot; early tests show it outperforms internal coding benchmarks while cutting token usage roughly in half.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Pull request “Files changed” public preview – November 20 updates
item.description:
GitHub announced a public preview (Nov 20) that lets you view the pull request description directly on the new “Files changed” page so reviewers don’t need to scroll, switch tabs, or lose context.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Actions cache size can now exceed 10 GB per repository
item.description:
GitHub expanded GitHub Actions cache storage so repository cache size can now exceed 10 GB, allowing projects to retain more build dependencies between workflow runs.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Linter integration with Copilot code review now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot Code Review now integrates linter feedback directly into code reviews and lets repositories specify which linters to use via repository rulesets. The feature is available in public preview so teams can start surfacing and customizing actionable linter suggestions within reviews.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Enterprise bring your own key (BYOK) for GitHub Copilot is now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced that Enterprise Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) for GitHub Copilot is now in public preview. The feature responds to enterprise demand for greater flexibility, enabling teams that already use specific LLM providers or custom models to integrate those workflows with Copilot.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: CodeQL 2.23.5 adds support for Swift 6.2, new Java queries, and improved analysis accuracy
item.description:
GitHub released CodeQL 2.23.5, the static analysis engine used by GitHub code scanning. This update adds support for Swift 6.2, introduces three new Java security queries, and improves analysis accuracy.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot CLI: New models, enhanced code search, and better image support
item.description:
GitHub announced updates to Copilot CLI that add support for the latest AI models, improve code search capabilities, provide better image handling, and include reliability and performance enhancements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Auto model selection for Copilot in JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot now offers an Auto model selection option in Copilot Chat for JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse. Selecting Auto lets Copilot choose the most appropriate model for you; the feature is available in public preview.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Enhanced MCP OAuth support for GitHub Copilot in JetBrains, Eclipse, and Xcode
item.description:
GitHub Copilot plugins for JetBrains, Eclipse, and Xcode now include enhanced authentication capabilities that expand support for third‑party OAuth providers using a secure, flexible approach based on Dynamic Client Registration (DCR).

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Custom agents available in GitHub Copilot for JetBrains, Eclipse, and Xcode now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot now offers custom agents in public preview for JetBrains IDEs, Eclipse, and Xcode. These agents let teams package reusable expertise, enforce guardrails, and grant tool access so AI behavior can be tailored to specific projects and workflows.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Unified code-to-cloud artifact risk visibility with Microsoft Defender for Cloud now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced a public preview integration with Microsoft Defender for Cloud that provides unified risk visibility across code, build artifacts, and production context so teams can track, prioritize, and remediate the security risks that matter.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Isolated Subagents for JetBrains, Eclipse, and Xcode now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced that isolated subagents are now in public preview for JetBrains IDEs, Eclipse, and Xcode. These subagents, powered by isolated context, let developers delegate focused tasks to autonomous agents. The announcement appeared on the GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot Next Edit Suggestions (NES) now in public preview for Xcode and Eclipse
item.description:
GitHub announced that Copilot Next Edit Suggestions (NES) is now in public preview for Xcode and Eclipse. The feature offers next-logical-edit suggestions to help developers move faster, and the announcement appears on the GitHub Blog changelog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot coding agent for Eclipse now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot coding agent is now available in public preview for Eclipse, bringing Copilot directly into native Eclipse workflows and adding features such as the ability to delegate tasks from within the IDE.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Plan mode in GitHub Copilot now in public preview in JetBrains, Eclipse, and Xcode
item.description:
GitHub Copilot’s Plan mode is now available in public preview for JetBrains IDEs, Eclipse, and Xcode, announced on the GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Internal MCP registry and allowlist controls for VS Code Stable in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced that enterprise and organization administrators can configure internal MCP registries and enforce allowlist policies in the latest VS Code Stable release (public preview), extending governance controls to the majority of Copilot users.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Gemini 3 Pro is in public preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
Google’s Gemini 3 Pro model is now available in public preview within GitHub Copilot for Pro, Pro+ Business, and Enterprise subscribers; the rollout is gradual and announced on the GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Migrating repositories with GitHub-owned blob storage is now generally available
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise Importer (GEI) can now migrate repositories to GitHub Enterprise Cloud (GHEC) using GitHub-owned blob storage. This feature is generally available and removes the need to provide shared access keys during migration.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Improved enterprise license consumption reporting for outside collaborators now generally available
item.description:
GitHub updated the enterprise licensing CSV export to include outside collaborators so enterprises can better track license consumption across organizations. The improvement is now generally available.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Billing date standardized to the first of the month for self-serve credit card metered Enterprise customers now generally available
item.description:
Effective December 1, 2025, GitHub will standardize the billing date to the first of each month for usage-based products paid by credit card for self-serve metered Enterprise customers. The billing period stays as the calendar month. This change is now generally available.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Block repository administrators from installing GitHub Apps on their own now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub added a new organization-level setting (now in public preview) that lets organization owners restrict which users can install GitHub Apps for repositories. This blocks repository administrators from installing GitHub Apps on their own, giving owners tighter control over app installation and repository security.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Fine-grain permissions for Copilot usage metrics now available
item.description:
GitHub added a fine-grain enterprise role—“View enterprise Copilot metrics”—that grants access to the Copilot Usage Metrics APIs and the Copilot Usage Dashboard so assigned users can view enterprise-level Copilot usage data.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Configure Copilot coding agent as a bypass actor for rulesets
item.description:
GitHub added an option to configure the Copilot coding agent as a bypass actor for repository rulesets, so Copilot-driven activity can be exempted from rules that would otherwise block automation or generated commits.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: OpenAI’s GPT-5.1, GPT-5.1-Codex and GPT-5.1-Codex-Mini are now in public preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub Copilot has begun a public preview rollout of OpenAI’s latest 5.1-series models—GPT-5.1, GPT-5.1-Codex, and GPT-5.1-Codex-Mini—bringing the new general and code-specialized models (including a smaller, low‑cost/low‑latency Codex-Mini) to Copilot users. The announcement was posted on the GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: New GitHub Actions OIDC token claims
item.description:
GitHub Actions OIDC tokens now include a check_run_id claim, allowing workflows to present a run-specific identifier to external services. This change enables more fine-grained attribute-based access control and improved auditability for integrations.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Manage Copilot coding agent tasks in Visual Studio Code
item.description:
GitHub announced that you can now track and manage the Copilot coding agent directly within Visual Studio Code using a streamlined, centralized “mission control” view that includes access to session logs and management tools without leaving the editor.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot code review and coding agent now support agent-specific instructions
item.description:
GitHub added support for agent-specific custom instructions for Copilot code review and the Copilot coding agent by introducing an excludeAgent property in .instructions.md files, letting you control when particular instructions apply or are ignored.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Secret scanning improves private key detection, updates Sentry pattern names
item.description:
GitHub secret scanning now recognizes additional private key formats and has upgraded its existing private key detectors to better catch exposed cryptographic credentials. The release also updates Sentry-related pattern names used in scanning.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Auto model selection for Copilot in Visual Studio in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio now offers an ‘Auto’ option in the model picker (public preview) that selects the best Copilot model for you automatically.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Claude Sonnet 3.5 deprecated, Claude Haiku 4.5 available in Copilot Free
item.description:
GitHub deprecated Claude Sonnet 3.5 across all Copilot experiences on November 10, 2025, and made Claude Haiku 4.5 available in Copilot Free.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency now supports Visual Studio subscriptions
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency now supports Visual Studio subscriptions, letting organizations use GitHub Enterprise features via Visual Studio subscriptions while keeping data stored in chosen regions for compliance. The support applies to both subscription-based and usage-based (metered) GitHub Enterprise plans.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Raptor mini is rolling out in public preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub has begun a public preview rollout of Raptor mini, an experimental model available in GitHub Copilot for Visual Studio Code. The model is being made available to users on Pro, Pro+, and Free plans and can be selected within the Copilot settings. The announcement appeared on the GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Removing notifications for @mentions in commit messages
item.description:
GitHub is removing notifications that come from @mentions inside commit messages to reduce spam and help users focus on important notifications. Previously, mentioning a user or team in a commit message would generate a notification; that behavior is being removed.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Actions pull_request_target and environment branch protections changes
item.description:
GitHub will change how Actions’ pull_request_target and environment branch protection rules are evaluated for pull-request-related events, effective 2025-12-08, to reduce security-critical exposures.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GraphQL Explorer removal from API documentation on November 7, 2025
item.description:
On November 7, 2025 GitHub retired the GraphQL Explorer from its API documentation. The change, following a prior announcement, affects a small number of users who used the Explorer to experiment with the GitHub GraphQL API.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Pull request “Files changed” public preview and merge experience – November 6 updates
item.description:
GitHub updated the public preview of the new pull request ‘Files changed’ page (Nov 6). Highlights include the ability to apply suggested changes in batch, new options to collapse parts of the page for easier navigation, and improvements to the merge experience.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: New releases for GitHub Actions – November 2025
item.description:
GitHub increased limits for reusable workflows in GitHub Actions (November 2025): workflows can now nest up to 10 reusable workflows and a single workflow run can call up to 50 workflows in total.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Improved onboarding flow for GitHub Projects
item.description:
GitHub updated the Projects onboarding flow to help users start faster by adding options to connect and import items from a repository and to set a default repository for new issues.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: The legacy Copilot usage report CSV is no longer available
item.description:
GitHub has retired the legacy Copilot usage report CSV that organization administrators could access under Copilot access settings; the report was deprecated three months earlier and is now no longer available.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: enterprise: qualifier is now generally available in GitHub code search
item.description:
GitHub code search now includes a new enterprise: qualifier (generally available) that lets you search across all organizations in your enterprise, simplifying searches that previously required manually combining multiple organizations.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot coding agent supports organization custom instructions
item.description:
GitHub announced that the Copilot coding agent — its asynchronous, autonomous background agent — now supports organization-level custom instructions to guide how Copilot understands and works with projects.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot coding agent now supports pull request templates
item.description:
GitHub’s Copilot coding agent, an autonomous background agent that creates and updates pull requests with a summary of its changes, now supports repository pull request templates so its generated PR bodies follow your repo’s template while still inserting the agent’s summary.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: npm security update: Classic token creation disabled and granular token changes
item.description:
GitHub announced an npm security update that disables creation of classic tokens and introduces the first changes toward a granular token management system to strengthen npm security.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Secret scanning detects Base64-encoded secrets and more — October 2025
item.description:
GitHub announced October 2025 updates to its secret scanning service, including new detection for Base64-encoded secrets and other expanded support for additional secret types.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot policy update for unconfigured policies
item.description:
GitHub fixed an issue that sometimes caused organization-level Copilot policies to display incorrect options when the enterprise-level policy was set to “Unconfigured.” The change ensures organizations now see the correct Copilot policy options in that scenario.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Required review by specific teams now available in rulesets
item.description:
